intro: Hebenstretia integrifolia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming compact rosettes. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated by small insects. Hebenstretia integrifolia is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
